content: stitches the first method is to use the long-tail cast-on and standard bind-off or any combination that creates a moderately stretchy edge once finished simply sew the ends together this will create a small seam where the edges meet in the pattern make sure to cast on and bind off in pattern to make the seam less visible for a seamless finish use a provisional cast-on and when you ve worked the full length graft the ends together in pattern one more thing - skip the two preparation row and jump straight into the 8-row repeat after casting on those prep row only exist to make the first cable crosses easier when you already have a bit of fabric but they aren t needed when you re grafting the piece later pattern we begin with knitting 2 preparational row row 1 k1 p1 k1 p3 k2 p4 k4 p4 k2 p3 k1 p1 k1 row 2 k1 p1 k1 p1 k2 p2 k4 p4 k4 p2 k2 p1 k1 p1 k1 8-row repeat row 1 k1 p1 k1 p3 k2 p4 2/2 lc p4 k2 p3 k1 p1 k1 row 2 k1 p1 k1 p1 k2 p2 k4 p4 k4 p2 k2 p1 k1 p1 k1 row 3 k1 p1 k1 p3 2/2 lpc 2/2 rpc 2/2 lpc 2/2 rpc p3 k1 p1 k1 row 4 k1 p1 k1 p1 k4 p4 k4 p4 k4 p1 k1 p1 k1 row 5 k1 p1 k1 p5 2/2 rc p4 2/2 rc p5 k1 p1 k1 row 6 k1 p1 k1 p1 k4 p4 k4 p4 k4 p1 k1 p1 k1 row 7 k1 p1 k1 p3 2/2 rpc 2/2 lpc 2/2 rpc 2/2 lpc p3 k1 p1 k1 row 8 k1 p1 k1 p1 k2 p2 k4 p4 k4 p2 k2 p1 k1 p1 k1 k - knit p- purl 2/2 lc - cable left 2/2 rc - cable right 2/2 lpc - cable left 2 purl stitches followed by 2 knit stitches 2/2 rpc - cable right 2 knit stitches followed by 2 purl stitches
